description:
This includes some changes that were successful, some that weren't, but the net diff is where I ended up.  It refactors the lens vector calculation to make it slightly more generic inside the `grid_traversal.pyx` file.

"What does this do for us?" I hear you asking.  Well, it *should* help us to write lens-specific occlusion functions, which will help speed up intersection detection (by filtering out the partitioned grids not to bother with) for other lenses -- like perspective camera.

The net result of this particular PR should be *zero* change in behavior.  If there is a change in net behavior, it's broken.

Also, this includes some of @xarthisius's changes.
title: Refactor lens vector computation
